issue.title: [Python] Add Table.drop method for removing columns
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1388](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1388). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See ARROW-1374 for a use case. This function should take as an input a list of columns and return a new Table instance without them.

A well-defined interface for this implementation can be found in Pandas: https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.DataFrame.drop.html

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1388?focusedCommentId=16147187) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
We already have `Table.remove_column`. Shouldn't that already suffice?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1388?focusedCommentId=16148002) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
That removes a single column. It might be nice to have a convenience function that accepts a list of integers or a list of field names to drop, like pandas

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1388?focusedCommentId=16156366) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Removed from 0.7.0 as non-urgent
